references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian Splatting for Real-Time Radiance Field Rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS), a novel and efficient representation for 3D scenes, used as a core component in Wonderland.
This work is foundational for diffusion models, laying the theoretical groundwork for image and video generation, upon which Wonderland's camera-guided video model is built.

references.paper_title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
references.reason: This paper describes Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs) used for generating high-quality images from text prompts, contributing to the generative capabilities of Wonderland.

references.paper_title: NeRF: Representing Scenes as Neural Radiance Fields for View Synthesis
references.reason: This work introduces Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), a popular technique for representing and rendering 3D scenes, frequently compared to and used as an alternative to 3DGS.

references.paper_title: LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
references.reason: This work proposes Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), an efficient technique for fine-tuning large models, which Wonderland utilizes to adapt the pre-trained video model for specific tasks.
